page.title: 12MUTHILL CHILD'S DAY
page.content: {Saturday,18th May, 1985.} I had my breakfast at 9.30. We went to the shops in Crieff to buy papers for my Dad, and a birthday present for Fiona McGregor.We took Jinty, our golden retriever for a walk at Lady Mary's Walk till twelve. My lunch was salad. In the salad was lettuce, tomatoes , meat and cucumber. After that I went to Fiona's party from 2.30 till 4.30.First we played musical statues, then went outside for the barbecue. It was just a snack. We had beefburgers and sausages in a roll. I went home and had my tea at 5.50 p.m. I went out and played with my brother Sandy till 6.45 p.m. I went in and had my bath . I went to bed at 8 p.m. ( Written by Fiona Drysdale, aged 8, Class Primary 4,Muthill Primary School)
